summary: The Crime Victims Fund Stabilization Act of 2025 aims to temporarily increase deposits into the Crime Victims Fund. It amends the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 by adding a provision to include funds recovered from the False Claims Act (31 U.S.C. 3729-3731) from the date of enactment through fiscal year 2029.  Specifically, it details that funds used to pay 'qui tam' plaintiffs and those reimbursing the US government for damages are exempt from deposit into the fund.
